title: What it Means When Someone Says "Grand Rising" & How to Reply

steps.title: “Grand rising” means “good morning.”
steps.content: “Grand rising” means “good morning.” Some people prefer to say “grand rising” in place of “good morning” because “morning” sounds the same as “mourning,” which refers to grieving the death of someone who has passed away. [1] X Research source Though this comes down to personal preference, many people see “grand rising” as a more positive way to wish people a happy start to the day without any possible implications of death or loss.

steps.title: “Grand rising” is a spiritual affirmation.
steps.content: “Grand rising” is a spiritual affirmation. Many people start their day by saying “grand rising” as a way to thank God or a higher power for another day of life. Saying “grand rising” is a spiritual affirmation that you’ve risen as the sun has before you and that you’re grateful to experience another beautiful day on the planet. [2] X Research source “Grand rising” is thought to have originated in the Caribbean and continues to be used in Black culture as a greeting acknowledging the spirit’s safe return to the body after a night’s sleep or as a reminder to rise up against oppression. [3] X Research source Keep the good vibes flowing all day by thinking positively and taking time to appreciate all the little things that make you happy. Sometimes all it takes is a great cup of coffee to bring a smile to your face!

steps.title: “Grand rising” can mean “Rise up and fight!”
steps.content: “Grand rising” can mean “Rise up and fight!” Much like using “grand rising” as a spiritual affirmation, “grand rising” is also said as a way to pep yourself up for the day. "Grand rising” reminds us to meet challenges with bravery and determination, as well as fight for what you believe in. If something or someone challenges your beliefs, remember to always converse with an open mind and consider different perspectives before placing judgment on someone else–you never know what you might learn. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Say “grand rising” back to someone who said it to you.
steps.content: Say “grand rising” back to someone who said it to you. “Grand rising” is a fun twist on the tried-and-true “good morning,” so it might be fun to switch it up and say it right back. You can keep it basic and just stick to the phrase itself, or you could go one step further and ask how they’re doing. “Grand rising to you too!” “Grand rising! How are you doing today?”

steps.title: Go for a classic “good morning” if “grand rising” isn’t your thing.
steps.content: Go for a classic “good morning” if “grand rising” isn’t your thing. If someone said “grand rising” to you, and it’s not your cup of tea, saying the tried-and-true “good morning” instead is fine! Just acknowledge the person respectfully. “Good morning! Quite the day we’re having.” “Hey, good morning!”

steps.title: Just say “thank you” as a response to "grand rising."
steps.content: Just say “thank you” as a response to "grand rising." If you’re not a morning person and “grand rising” feels a little overboard, a simple “thank you” in response is sufficient enough! Just because someone says “grand rising” doesn’t mean you have to say it back. “Thanks! You too.” “Thank you, it really is a beautiful day!”

steps.title: Say “grand rising” in place of “good morning.”
steps.content: Say “grand rising” in place of “good morning.” If you see someone out and about and feel like saying hello, why not give “grand rising” a try? You can always add an “it means good morning!” if they seem confused. They may be happy to learn a fun, new phrase, and who knows, you might just make a friend. [5] X Research source “Grand rising, Joe! So glad we got to meet for breakfast this morning.” “Hey Isabelle, grand rising. It’s been a great day so far!”

steps.title: Use “grand rising” to thank God or a higher power when you wake up.
steps.content: Use “grand rising” to thank God or a higher power when you wake up. If you’re a spiritual person and like to practice gratiude , saying “grand rising” first thing when you wake up is a wonderful way to start the day off right. Studies suggest that simply thinking positively and acknowledging the things you appreciate rather than the things you dislike can massively improve your quality of life. [6] X Trustworthy Source Johns Hopkins Medicine Official resource database of the world-leading Johns Hopkins Hospital Go to source “Grand rising! I’m thankful for another beautiful day.” The sun is shining, and it’s a grand rising. I will focus on the good today.”

steps.title: Express your gratitude for the day with "grand rising."
steps.content: Express your gratitude for the day with "grand rising." Sometimes people will say “grand rising” to show their appreciation for another day of life or remark on the beauty of the morning. [7] X Research source If you’re having a “grand rising” yourself, making an effort to point out a wonderful part of your morning is a great way to respond. “Grand rising! Did you see how beautiful the sky was this morning?”

steps.title: Say “grand rising” to motivate yourself for another day.
steps.content: Say “grand rising” to motivate yourself for another day. Life gets stressful–whether you have a big project due at school, or an important pitch at work, sometimes rising to face the day can be challenging. When you wake up, start the day by saying “grand rising” as a reminder to rise up and fight! No one is a better champion for achieving your goals than yourself–self-confidence is key to leading a better life . [8] X Research source “Grand rising! I am capable of achieving great things.” “This is a grand rising. I will not let the fear of failure stop me from trying.”
